SOUBLET'S BEAUTY SHOP
2O14 E. Broadway
BR 6-3964

asked that this motion be con-
solidated with unfair labor prac-
tees proceedings previously in
stituted by the NLRB against
Local l.


On February 26, 1868, the
NLRB trial examiner in an inter-
mediate report handed down a
decision affirming the NAACP
charges. In compliance with
NLRB procedures, the NAACP
filed a brief on April rs, 1868,
and requested that. date be set
for oral argument. A similar
request for an early hearing was
again made on December 2, 1868.
Two days later, the Boards exec
utive secretary Informed the Ma
ACP that the case was being
analysed and consideration being
given to the request for oral
argument.


In again requesting a hearing,
Mr.. Carter emphasized @the
great importance of this case
in defining the rights Of Negro
employees to bring proceedings
under the National Labor Rela-
tons Act to protect themselves
from union or employer discrim-
nation"

Thomas Watkins, 81, 824 E.
Eighth ST., Mesa, announced his
candidacy for Sheriff of Maricopa
County.


A Mesa builder and mobile
home salesman, Watkins seeks
the Republican nomination.


He said his policy would in
clude improvement of law en-
forcement and reduction of de-
partment expenditures.

NEW YORK Singer Jackie
Wilson's apartment was robbed
by thieves who cracked his safe
and stole six gold records and his
coin collection.


The records synbolized tunes
which had sold over a million
copies.

I Does a United States citizen


forfeit his citizenship when


he marries an alien?
2 Who was the Lady with


the Lamp?


3 How did the United States


get t h e nickname Uncle


Sam?


4 How many instruments


make up a modern S Y M


phony orchestra?
S What famous Southern song


was written by N or h.


erner?


3 Who was the first American


novelist to earn his living


by writing?


7 Which of the 13 colonies


was founded as a haven for


imprisoned debtors?


NAACP PRODS NLRB TO ACT
ON UNION BIAS COMPLAINT
NEW YORK 1.-The National
Association for the Advancement
of Colored People has asked the
National Labor Relations Board
for oral argument or final
decision on a complaint, filed
October "a, 1862, alleging racial
discrimination by the all-white
Local l of the Independent Metal
Workers Union representing en-
ployees of the Hughes Tool Com
pany in Huston, Texas.


The case involves charges of
discriminatory practices by
Local l against members Of the
all-Negro Local 2 of the IMWU
at the Hughes plant in Huston.
In 1862 when a Negro member
of Local was denied admission
to company sponsored appren-
ticeship training course, the
white local refused to process
his grievance, saying that it's
constitution forbade the handling
Of complaints Of Negro employ
ees.


At the request Of Local 2,
the NAACP filed a motion with
the NLRB asking that Local rs
certification be reSc inded. It also

full articles.headline: JACKIE ROBBED
full articles.article:
NEW YORK Singer Jackie
Wilson's apartment was robbed
by thieves who cracked his safe
and stole six gold records and his
coin collection.


The records synbolized tunes
which had sold over a million
copies.
